Direzione o partecipazione a comitati ed.content: Co-edited (with Francesca Bettio) a volume on Frontiers in the Economics of Gender (2008) which makes part of the series Routledge Siena studies in politicla economy

Organizzazione o partecipazione come rel.content: “The Distribution of Wages in Belarus”, XVII AIEL conference, University of Salerno.
“The Distribution of Wages in Belarus”, IV Global Development Network Conference (GDN), Cairo, Egypt.
“Private Returns to Human Capital over Transition. The Case Study of Belarus”, XVI EALE Conference, Lisbon, Portugal.
“The Gender Wage Gap in Belarus”, 17th EERC Workshop, Moscow, Russia
“On female labour force participation and their job remuneration in transition”, 20th EERC Workshop, Kiev, Ukraine.
“Overeducation and inefficiency. Individual and social outcomes in Belarus”, Athens Institute for Education and Research (ATINER), Athens, Greece.
“Intergenerational Educational Mobility under Socialism and After”, IX Global Development Network Conference (GDN), Brisbane, Australia.
“Education and socioeconomic mobility in post-communist countries”, XXV AIEL conference, University of Chieti-Pescara.
“Living through the crisis in Italy. Labour market experience of men and women”, International Symposium on Women, Gender Equality and Economic Crisis, University of Iceland, Reykjavík, Iceland

“Added versus discouraged worker effect during the recent crisis: evidence from Italy”: - IWPLMS 33rd Annual Conference, Sapienza University of Rome, Italy, 13-15 September; - 5th ESPAnet Italia Conference, Sapienza University of Rome, Italy, 20-22 September; - Workshop on Disadvantaged Workers: Short and Long-Term Perspectives, University of Chieti-Pescara, Italy, 29 –30 November.
“Educational qualifications mismatch in Europe. Is it demand or supply driven?”, 53rd Annual Conference of the Italian Economic Association (SIE), University of Basilicata, Matera
“Secondary earners and fiscal policies in Europe”, ENEGE annual meeting, European Commission, Brussels.
“Secondary earners and fiscal policies in Europe”, EUROMOD winter school in cross-country microsimulation, University of Essex.

“Secondary earners and fiscal policies in Europe”, invited speaker at the conference on Individual taxation and employment, organized by the Ministry of Labour, Employment and the Social and Solidarity Economy on the occasion of the 2015 Luxembourgish Presidency of the Council of the European Union, Luxembourg.
“The impact of mass media on attitudes to inequality”, ECINEQ winter school on Inequality and Social Welfare Theory, University of Verona, Canazei.
“Immigrazione e commercio internazionale: il caso del Veneto”, Università di Verona, Polo Scientifico Didattico Studi sull’Impresa, Vicenza.
“Mass media and attitudes to inequality”, 57th Annual conference of the Italian Economic Association, University “L.Bocconi”, Milan.

Responsabilita' di studi e ricerche scie.content: Research Project on “Gender segregation in the labour market: root causes, implications and policy responses in the EU” , implemented for the Fondazione G. Brodolini, within the EGGE network [Co-PI]
Research Project on 'Fiscal system and female employment in Europe', implemented for the Fondazione G. Brodolini within the EGGE network [Co-PI]
Research Project on 'Elderly care in Europe. Provisions and providers in 33 countries' implemeted for the Fondazione G. Brodolini, within the EGGE network [co-PI]
“Study on the role and impact of labour taxation policies”, coordinated by Econpubblica / Bocconi University, for the European Commission [investigator]
Research project on the 'Young workers overeducation in Italy and in Europe', financed by Sapienza University of Rome [investigator]
'Crisis and recovery in Europe. Labour market impact on men and women', implemented for the Fondazione G. Brodolini [investigator + national expert for Italy], within the EGGE network
Research Project on 'Secondary Earners and Fiscal Policies in Europe', implemented for the Fondazione G.Brodolini within the ENEGE network [co-PI].
'The influence of media and social networks on political outcomes', financed by Sapienza University of Rome [investigator]
'Il ruolo degli immigrati nello sviluppo dell'area Vicentina', Polo Scientifico Didattico Studi sull'Impresa, Vicenza [investigator]

'Partecipazione al mercato del lavoro delle neo-madri in Italia: il ruolo dei servizi per l’infanzia, delle politiche di maternità e delle riforme del mercato del lavoro', Università Politecnica delle Marche [investigator]

Conseguimento di premi e riconoscimenti.content: Finalist for a Research Medal GDN 2002 Competition, with a paper 'The Distribution of Wages in Belarus' (co-authored with F. Pastore). Published in Comparative Economic Studies (2006), 48(2): 351-376.

Winner of the Berkeley Electronic Press 2007 Arrow Prize for Junior Economists for a paper 'The Inheritance of Educational Inequality: International Comparisons and Fifty-Year Trends' (co-authored with T. Hertz, T. Jayasundera, P. Piraino, S. Selcuk, and N. Smith). Published in The B.E. Journal of Economic Analysis and Policy, 2007, 7(2) (Advances), Article 10 [http://www.bepress.com/arrow.html]

Partecipazione al collegio dei docenti o.content: PhD degree (external member of the Commission), CERGE University of Prague
Membro delle Commissioni di Laurea (Magistrale), Sapienza Università di Roma

Formale attribuzione di incarichi di ins.content: Teaching Assistant for the course Politiche del Lavoro (Laurea Magistrale), held by Prof.ssa Marina Capparucci, Sapienza University of Rome.
Labour Economics, 10-hour mini-course for postgraduate students, BEROC post-graduate school, Minsk, Belarus [http://eng.beroc.by/]
Labour Economics, 12-hour module for PhD students, University of Chieti-Pescara, Italy.
Relatore / Correlatore per le tesi di Laurea Magistrale, Sapienza Università di Roma (6 studenti)
Course lecturer: European Economic Policies (Master in Advanced Economics, first year), Sapienza University of Rome (9 cfu/72 hours).
Economia Politica (Corso di Recupero e Sostegno), Sapienza Università di Roma (40 ore).
Lecturer for the course on Labour Policies (Master in Advanced Economics, first year), Sapienza University of Rome (6cfu/48 hours).
Economia Politica (Corso di Recupero e Sostegno), Sapienza Università di Roma (35 ore).
Supporto alla didattica per il corso di Economia Politica I (35 ore) e Economia Politica II (35 ore), A.A. 2016/2017, Università Politecnica delle Marche

Specifiche esperienze professionali cara.content: Membro della Associazione Italiana Economisti Lavoro (AIEL)
First Summer School on Labour Market Policy Evaluation, University of Salerno, Ascea.
Eighteenth International School of Economic Research: “Gender and Economics”, University of Siena, Certosa di Pontignano.

Referee for Journal of Population Economics, International Journal of Manpower, Eastern European Economics, Journal of Comparative Economics, The European Journal of Development Research, Higher Education Policy, Italian Economic Journal, the Czech Science Foundation (GA ČR)
Seventh Summer School in International and Development Economics: “International Migration and the Sending Country”, University of Milan, Gargnano.
Membro della Società Italiana degli Economisti (SIE), Italian Economic Association
EUROMOD winter school in cross-country microsimulation, University of Essex.
ECINEQ winter school on Inequality and Social Welfare Theory, University of Verona, Canazei.
Membro del Centro di Ricerca Interuniversitario "Ezio Tarantelli" (CIRET), Sapienza Università di Roma [http://www.ciret.it/]

Direzione o partecipazione alle attivit\.content: EGGE (Expert Group on Gender and Employment) network, by the European Commission. Member of coordinating team
ENEGE (European Network of Experts on Gender Equality) network, by the European Commission. Member of the Core Experts Group
SAAGE (Scientific Analysis and Advise on Gender Equality in the EU), by the European Commission.

Responsabilita' scientifica per progetti.content: Research Project on “Transitional Labour Markets in the CIS”, financed through the CNR-NATO outreach fellowship
Research Project on “Problems of Labour Market Regulation in the EU-CIS Economic Integration”, financed through the CNR-NATO outreach fellowship.
Research Project on 'The Gender Wage Gap in the Republic of Belarus' financed by EERC, Economics Education and Research Consortium, CIS Research Network (http://www.eerc.ru)
